0: Chicago (CNN) A Northwestern professor and an Oxford University employee were arrested Friday after a national manhunt following the stabbing death of a Chicago cosmetologist. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Wyndham Lathem turned himself in Friday evening in Oakland, California, after authorities made contact with him, while Andrew Warren surrendered to police in San Francisco, according to the US Marshals. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The suspects in the death of Trenton Cornell-Duranleau are now awaiting extradition to Illinois. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Cornell-Duranleau, 26, was found dead from multiple stab wounds in Lathem's Chicago apartment on July 27. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Lathem, 42, is an associate professor of microbiology and immunology at Northwestern and Warren, 56, works for Oxford University in England. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Prior to the arrests, Lathem had sent a video to his friends and family in which he talks about the biggest mistake of his life, a high-level source at the Chicago Police Department told CNN on Friday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR CNN has not seen the video and police are not releasing it, but Chicago Police spokesman Anthony Guglielmi characterized it as Professor Wyndham Lathem "apologizing for his involvement in the murder of Trenton Cornell-(Duranleau)." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR His death occurred the same day that one of the suspects walked into the public library of Lake Geneva, a Wisconsin resort city about an hour's drive from Chicago, and made a $1,000 cash donation in Cornell-Duranleau's name. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Victim was 'mutilated,' source says NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR On Wednesday, Chicago police issued first-degree murder arrest warrants for Lathem and Warren. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Chicago police were tight-lipped about many details. They said they could not elaborate on any possible relationship between the victim and the two suspects. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A high-ranking police official on Thursday told CNN that responding officers found a horrific scene in Lathem's River North apartment. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "The victim was savagely murdered," the official said. Frankly, he was "mutilated." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police recovered what they believed to be a murder weapon -- a broken blade. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Cook County medical examiner's office said the autopsy is not complete. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to CNN affiliate WLS , investigators determined that Warren had recently come to Chicago from England but didn't know whether he knew the victim. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Wanted for Murder by CPD - Our search will only intensify. Prof Latham & Mr Warren, do the right thing & turn yourself in to any police dept pic.twitter.com/fwWkcfFfco â€” Anthony Guglielmi (@AJGuglielmi) August 2, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police had said they believed the two suspects have fled the state. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "We do have an idea of their whereabouts and efforts to locate them are only intensifying from here on in," police said in an email to CNN. "Our primary focus is to facilitate a safe surrender." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Federal agencies, including US marshals, assisted in the search. Lathem's passport and Warren's travel visa were restricted. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 'This place is very safe' NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The apartment is in an upscale high-rise called the Grand Plaza Apartments. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "There's shock, there's no doubt about it. You know, this place is very safe," Grand Plaza resident Richard Aili told WLS . "I've been here 14 years and I've never heard of problems such as that." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Northwestern said in a statement that Lathem "has been placed on administrative leave and banned from entering the Northwestern University campuses." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "This is now a criminal matter under investigation by the appropriate authorities, and Northwestern University is cooperating in that investigation," according to the statement. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Lathem joined the Northwestern faculty in 2007 and researched bacteria that cause disease in humans, particularly lung infections, according to his university biography page, which has since been removed. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He spoke at conferences and has appeared in videos about disease research. One posted earlier this year details how an organism contributed to pneumonic plague NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Victim remembered as friendly, a 'character' NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A hairstylist fondly recalled Cornell-Duranleau. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He was a nice kid who got along with everyone. People loved him. He was friendly," Peggy Bosel told CNN. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Bosel has been a hairstylist at Timber's Salon in Trenton, Michigan, for 19 years and said Cornell-Duranleau worked there for around a year and a half. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He loved people and was really trying to get into the hair business, but that wasn't working out too well. It's a hard business," Bosel said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She said Cornell-Duranleau was a "character" and had a good sense of humor. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The stylist said she and colleagues had never heard of the suspects. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Cornell-Duranleau left the Michigan salon at least a couple years ago, Bosel said. "He wanted to expand himself and get more experience in the business." on an never mistake Friday cosmetologist.
